lg.l: NO: I'm unmov'd: nor can thy
One into my
I am from all those Free;
And you, in vain, speak to Me:
For through the Splendid Gallantrys of
Untouch'd, and careless, now I wildly rove,
From all th' of those proud Darts secure,
Whose Trifling too you indure;
Nor ought, on Earth's so to move
My and exact my Love:
Even Lovely and Inticeing Eyes,
Tho' arm'd with flames, I can at last despise;
With all the Genuine and Courtly
By which your Treacherous invade our
No more those little Things contract my
By a Diviner Excellence possest;
And, should I yield agen, it dear must cost
My e're he shall the Conquest Boast;
For the Mad Venome's quite expell'd my Veins,
And calmer now Triumphant Reigns:
No more the of my sight
Can move a of Delight;
Or force my lingring Blood a swifter pace,
Or Paint new and on my Face.
I've rent the from my heart,
And banisht all from thence that took his part.
No more the shall tempt me on
To and and think my self undone;
Whilst like some Torrent unconfin'd,
Breaks in, o'f-spreads, and swallows up my Mind;
And with its black ungrateful streams controul
All the Rays within my Soul.
No, No: I will, I will no more admire,
And urge the Sparks of the now dormant Fire:
Nor for a wild Fantastick Extasy,
Change the Dear of this blest Liberty;
Free, as a wandring through the Air,
Methinks I range, and hate my former Sphear.
I meet the Noblest yet scorn to pay
A Fond to well-moulded Clay:
Nor would I even for my late splendid Chain
Forgo this Charming again;
Which with so sweet a Calmness fill my
As cannot be in Words, no not in thine Exprest.
